parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post is from a page belonging to a senatorial candidate, Manolache Vasile, the content itself does not explicitly mention or promote him.  It focuses on the importance of free and fair elections, without advocating for any specific candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post uses inclusive language ("toți cei care au putere de decizie," "toți cetățenii") and is published on a public Facebook page, indicating an intention to reach a wide audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post seems to be to encourage free and fair elections, not to influence voters to choose a particular candidate. The call to vote freely and responsibly is a general appeal, not a specific endorsement.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents itself as a commentary on the electoral process, raising concerns about undue influence and advocating for democratic principles. While it lacks the rigorous fact-checking and balanced reporting typically associated with professional journalism, it shares some characteristics of citizen journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Partially True. The post expresses a personal opinion about the importance of free elections and condemns pressure tactics. However, this opinion is presented in a way that could be interpreted as a general call for democratic values rather than an attempt to sway votes for or against a specific candidate.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3475859886055163</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while originating from the page of a senatorial candidate, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The content focuses on the general principles of free and fair elections, condemning pressure tactics and advocating for voters' rights to choose freely.  It does not explicitly endorse or oppose any particular candidate, including Manolache Vasile himself. Although the post is paid for and targets a specific geographic area, the message itself is not directly related to influencing the vote for any candidate.  The lack of specific candidate mention, combined with the general appeal for democratic principles, suggests the post aims to promote broader democratic ideals rather than directly influencing the outcome of the election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MOMENTUM MOTION PICTURES SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
